intro: Codonoboea kenaboiensis, commonly known as the Kenaboiensis Codonoboea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae, which includes many species with showy, tubular flowers. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, brightly colored flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
